review_title: Best place for youth leadership development
job_title: National Director of Business Development in Singapore
pros:
- Quickest way to develop your leadership skills
- Many opportunities to work with people from all walks of life
- Many opportunities to interact with like-minded youths from overseas
- Great exposure and quick progression
cons:
- Time-consuming especially for part time roles
- Very intense and challenging for young people as it's usually the first business leadership experience
- Challenging to manage expectations with your team members as most of them are volunteers

pros: Opportunity to lead and discover your strength, Focus on growth and value
cons: Experience highly dependent on capabilities of your leader and your team. Cant learn much if you do not run higher positions

job_title: Finance Manager in Jurong West New Town,
pros: Like in a startup, the potential for growth is limitless - so long as you choose to be actively involved in areas outside of your jobscope
cons: The work can get pretty hectic and may not always be the most structured

pros:
culture,people and the network.

It is a NGO and highlights FUN so much!!!! You will enjoy being a member of this organization.
cons: No salary is paid to normal members, unless you are working for oversea AIESEC community---of course on basis that they hired you to do that.

review_title: Meaningful work in an environment with a lot of autonomy and flexibility
pros: Flexible Work, visible impact on the people you work with, lots of travel opportunities.
cons: NGO wages, frequent weekend work, one year terms can be challenging to deal with

pros:
- Good learning experience, which enhances your student life
- Great for networking and meeting new people
- Fulfilment of helping the world
Pick up many skills, as well as experience.
cons: I do not feel that there are cons.

pros: Lots of freedom to explore, initiate projects and experience new stuff
cons: Lack of good management skills and resources
